resources.string: International Day of Innocent Children Victims of Aggression
St. John’s Day (Spain and Latin America)
International Day Against Drug Abuse and Illicit Trafficking
Feast of Saints Peter and Paul (Christianity)
Celebrated in many countries to honor children and promote their welfare.
Marks the day in 1946 when Italy became a republic following a referendum.
Commemorates Eddie Mabo and his role in the landmark decision that recognized Indigenous land rights.
A United Nations observance to highlight the impact of conflict on children.
Celebrated globally to encourage awareness and action for the protection of the environment.
Celebrates the election of Gustav Vasa as King in 1523 and the adoption of a new constitution in 1809.
Honors journalists and the anniversary of the founding of the first Argentine newspaper in 1810.
Celebrated internationally to raise awareness about the importance of oceans and sustainable practices.
Commemorates those who contributed to Uganda\'s liberation struggles.
Celebrates Portuguese culture, history, and the death of national literary icon Luís de Camões in 1580.
Honors King Kamehameha the Great, who unified the Hawaiian Islands.
Marks the adoption of the Declaration of State Sovereignty of the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic in 1990.
A day to honor St. Anthony of Padua, celebrated with parades, feasts, and traditions.
Commemorates the adoption of the United States flag on June 14, 1777.
Remembers the signing of the Magna Carta in 1215, a significant document in the development of constitutional law.
Commemorates the Soweto Uprising of 1976, when students protested against apartheid education policies.
Celebrates Iceland\'s independence from Denmark in 1944.
Marks the anniversary of the Battle of Waterloo in 1815, where Napoleon Bonaparte was defeated.
Celebrates the emancipation of enslaved African Americans, marking the day in 1865 when news of the Emancipation Proclamation reached Texas.
Observed internationally to honor the strength and courage of refugees.
Celebrates yoga\'s physical, mental, and spiritual practices worldwide, established by the United Nations.
Commemorates the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush at Tilbury Docks in 1948, symbolizing the beginning of post-war migration from the Caribbean.
Recognizes the value of public service in the community and encourages young people to pursue careers in the public sector.
Celebrates the feast day of St. John the Baptist with various cultural traditions.
Marks Mozambique\'s independence from Portugal in 1975.
Promotes awareness about the dangers of drug abuse and encourages action to prevent it.
Raises awareness about Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder and supports those affected by it.
Remembers the Stonewall riots of 1969, which were a pivotal event in the LGBTQ+ rights movement.
Honors the martyrdom of the apostles Peter and Paul, celebrated by many Christian denominations.
Celebrates the return to civilian rule in Nigeria in 1999.
